title: Bucs agree to terms with Wilson
subtitle: Bucs agree to terms with Wilson
body: BRADENTON, Fla. -- The Pirates on Saturday avoided arbitration with outfielder/first baseman Craig Wilson by agreeing to terms with the slugger on a one-year deal worth $3.3 million.  Wilson, 29, tallied a career-high 29 home runs and 82 RBIs in 2004. However, he saw his production decline last season due to a pair of hand injuries that sidelined him for all but 59 games, during which he batted .264 with five home runs and 22 RBIs in 197 at-bats.  Wilson has spent his entire five-year big-league career with the Pirates. In 549 games, he has batted .268 with 81 home runs and 241 RBIs. He is Pittsburgh's all-time leader in pinch-hit home runs, with 11. Ed Eagle is a reporter for MLB.com. This story was not subject to the approval of Major League Baseball or its clubs.
author: Ed Eagle
